attributes.description:
CitClops/ Eye on Water collects data on water color through a citizen science methodology.   Volunteers use the Forel-Ule scale to classify water color, and collect additional data on environmental conditions including precipitation (rain).  In addition, volunteers submit a photo that is automatically classified through the WACODI algorithm.  Information from the WACODI classification and, in some cases, information from expert measurements are also included.

Some data are validated.  Non-validated data are flagged.  Information on data quality is available here.

If you would like to contribute data to Eye on Water, please visit the project website or SciStarter page.  

This is the Earth Challenge 2020 version of this data set.  Earth Challenge 2020 is an initiative that leverages the OGC SensorThings standard to increase the amount of open and interoperable citizen science data.  Fields in this data set align with the OGC SensorThings schema.
attributes.licenseInfo:
This data is licensed as Creative Commons - Public Domain (CC0).
.

idCitation.resTitle: Eye on Water/ Citclops: Earth Challenge 2020 version

dataIdInfo.idPurp:
Citclops/ Eye on water collects data on natural water-quality monitoring (water colour and transparency), to help oceanographers and limnologists.

This is the Earth Challenge 2020 version of this data set.
